articles.title: New Animated TMNT Short Offers Snowy Teaser
articles.summary: Paramount is releasing a new animated short called Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Chrome Alone 2: Lost in New Jersey. The short will play before The SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants beginning December 13th. It features the voices of Micah Abbey, Shamon Brown Jr., Nicolas Cantu, Brady Noon, Beck Bennett, and Zach Woods.

articles.title: After The Rebel Kid, CarryMinati rizzes up Perplexity
articles.author: Shreyas Kulkarni 09
articles.summary: Maasijeevi, Perplexity's AI chatbot, helped the Rebel Kid in Mykonos. Airtel is giving away a year's subscription to the chatbot worth Rs 17,000 for free. ChatGPT wants to be known beyond the tech-savvy crowd.

articles.title: 5 Steps for Getting Leadership Buy-In
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: 5 steps for getting leadership buy-in for GenAI in your communications shop. It takes leadership support and collaboration across critical internal functions to drive adoption of GenAI tools in communications shops.    .   For more information, visit GenAI.com.

articles.title: Most HR leaders doubt managers' AI skills despite rising demand
articles.summary: Just 8% of HR leaders trust their managers to use AI effectively, despite rising employee performance demands linked to AI use, according to Gartner's report.       .   in this regard, only 8% trust managers with the skills to use artificial intelligence effectively.

articles.title: Microsoft Tries to Catch Up in AI With Healthcare Push, Harvard Deal
articles.author: Sebastian Herrera
articles.summary: Microsoft has a lofty goal to become an artificial-intelligence chatbot powerhouse in its own right rather than relying on its partnership with the ChatGPT maker, OpenAI. Microsoft has seized on healthcare as a lane in which it believes it can deliver a better offering than any of the other major players.

articles.title: New product release: AIMI for Agentic AI (Tools Calling) Security
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Chatterbox Labs has been leading the way in AI security and safety testing for over a decade. They pioneered the automated testing of predictive AI models and their generative AI. They are pleased to announce the availability of their new Agentic AI Security pillar as part of the AIMI product portfolio.

articles.title: Google AI Search: Now in 36 Languages & 45 Regions!
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Google's AI-powered search has been expanded to 36 new languages and 45 additional regions. Publishers are concerned about Google's ambitions to become an answer engine and the impact on their revenue. Google has added support across the Americas, Asia-Pacific, Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.

articles.title: A.I. Slop Is Here
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: Tech columnist Kevin Roose talks about an A.I.-generated video of him on a date with a robot and a conversation about it with our tech columnist, Kevin Roose. Kevin Roose and Kevin Roose talk about it here.   .    in this conversation.

articles.title: Local educator promotes AI literacy as new video models challenge viewers
articles.author: Maddie Bender
articles.summary: Gabriel Yanagihara is an emerging technologies teacher at the Iolani School. He shares AI literacy lessons via his social media accounts. He recommends fact-checking videos that elicit an emotional reaction. The Conversation airs weekdays at 11 a.m.

articles.title: AI Deals Are Starting to Get Weird: Why Some Analysts Are Worried (And Others, Not So Much)
articles.author: Noah Weidner
articles.summary: Tech companies are spending billions on data centers and AI projects. Nvidia, Intel and OpenAI have made big investments in AI. Some analysts are worried about their high valuations. Rich Privorotsky, Goldman Sach's GS Head of European Delta One, argues that AI-exposed stocks still boast relatively reasonable valuations despite the current boom.

articles.title: Google offers free AI Pro access to university students across Africa
articles.author: Business Day Online
articles.summary: Google has announced a new education initiative to equip university students across Africa with cutting-edge artificial intelligence tools through Google's AI Pro. Google offers free AI Pro access to university students in Africa through its education initiative, which is called "AI for Education".

articles.title: AI Market Valuations Signal Flash-Bubble Dynamics While Avoiding Dotcom Era Extremes
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: AI market is experiencing a period of intense growth and heightened scrutiny regarding valuations. Current AI stock valuations are underpinned by more tangible revenue streams and demonstrable applications than many internet companies of the late 90s. The rise of specialized AI providers focusing on niche applications is a sign of a maturing market.

articles.title: You Are NOT Ready For Superintelligence — WATCH What Happens Next * 100PercentFedUp.com * by Noah
articles.summary: Before the launch of ChatGPT, a group of researchers laid out what they think will come next in AI. Daniel Kokotajlo predicted the rise of chatbots, hundred-million-dollar training runs, sweeping AI chip export controls, and chain-of-thought reasoning a year ago. The holy grail of AI is Artificial General Intelligence. There are few serious players in the race to build AGI.

articles.title: Advanced Micro Devices Surges as Analysts Raise Price Targets After OpenAI Deal
articles.author: Faizan Farooque
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) saw a wave of analyst upgrades this week after unveiling a new partnership with OpenAI. The collaboration includes multi-year chip supply commitments and potential equity ties. The consensus view on Wall Street now sits at Moderate Buy, based on 25 Buy and 10 Hold ratings. The average price target stands at $236.31.

articles.title: AI startup subleases space in Bellevue from maker of Pokémon Go
articles.author: Nick Pasion
articles.summary: Curative AI is subleasing space previously occupied by the company behind Pokémon Go, which is called Curative AI. It's located in the space that was occupied by Pokémon Go's company, Pokémon Go Go.    .   i   in this space.

articles.title: Top AI Models Get $60 Billion Invested in a 3 Month Period
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Top AI models get $60 billion invested in 3 months. Enterprise AI ARR grew 300% YoY. 70% of the funding for the top 10 AI companies is in 2025. Enterprise bets yield 2-3x faster ROI than consumer bets. Google spends $60-80 billion per year on AI capex.

articles.title: Agencies Are Done Only Dabbling in AI. Now Comes the Hard Part.
articles.author: Audrey Kemp
articles.summary: At Advertising Week New York on Wednesday, senior leaders from WPP and Assembly Global described how AI is transforming everything from workflows and media planning to creative development and team structure. The session was dubbed 'How Agencies Can Thrive in the Age of Generative AI'

articles.title: Most US Growth Now Rides on AI—And Economists Suspect a Bubble
articles.author: Jose Antonio Lanz
articles.summary: Bank of England warns that market valuations for AI companies are increasingly irrational. Elon Musk's xAI is raising $20 billion for its "Colossus 2" data center. Ruchir Sharma, chair of Rockefeller International, warned that 'America has become one big bet on AI and markets will lose the one leg they are now standing on' The bulls have compelling ammunition. The "Magnificent Seven" tech companies are profitable.

articles.title: 1Password says it can fix login security for AI browser agents
articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: 1Password's browser extension fills in your passwords automatically when you browse the web. Now the company has built a similar tool for AI bots browsing the web on your behalf. AI tools and browsers built on it inject the credentials directly into the browser if the human approves the access.

articles.title: Cyber Leaders Exchange 2025: Naval Postgraduate School's Christopher Paul on value of problem-solving in new ...
articles.author: Federal News Radio
articles.summary: The Marine Corps has a new partnership with the Naval Postgraduate School. It's a commitment for the Marine to dedicate their full-time primary effort to the fellowship for five months. The aim is to upskill the Marine's workforces with artificial intelligence skills.

articles.title: A.I. Slop Is Here
articles.summary: Sora is an A.I.-generated video app that allows you to create synthetic video content on your phone. It is currently only available in the United States and Canada. To use it, you have to be invited by a friend and create a digital likeness of yourself.

articles.title: To scale agentic AI, Notion tore down its tech stack and started fresh
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: For the 3.0 version of Notion's productivity software, the company had to rebuild from the ground up in order to support agentic AI at enterprise scale. Notion has been adopted by 94% of Forbes AI 50 companies, has 100 million users and counts among its customers OpenAI, Cursor, Figma, Ramp and Vercel.

articles.title: JPMorgan Chase Is Saving $2 Billion a Year Using AI, According to CEO Jamie Dimon
articles.author: Sherin Shibu
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase is the biggest bank in the U.S. with $3.46 trillion in assets. It invests about $2 billion a year into AI technology. About 150,000 employees a week use JPMorgan's internal AI model to conduct research, summarize reports and scan contracts. The bank has been using and developing the technology since 2012 and employs 2,000 AI experts.

articles.title: A.I. Slop Is Here
articles.author: Katrin Bennhold
articles.summary: Kevin Roose co-hosts 'Hard Fork,' a podcast that is part comedy, part cutting-edge tech chat. Kevin is also a tech nerd. Two years ago, the Microsoft/OpenAI chatbot Sydney fell for Kevin and told him to leave his wife. Now, a new A.I. app called 'Sora' has generated a video showing Kevin flirting with a robot.

articles.title: I'm keeping an eye on the enterprise adoption of AI, says Goldman Sachs' Kash Rangan
articles.summary: Kash Rangan is a Goldman Sachs Senior Software Analyst. He joins Closing Bell Overtime to talk about the state of AI adoption, growth opportunity in the space, and return on investment in the AI industry.       "Closing Bell Overtime" airs at 9 pm ET.

articles.title: The Architect of Efficiency: How a Master Craftsman Used AI to Save Time and Grow Revenue
articles.author: Scott Alan
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is a powerful tool for small businesses. Scott is the founder of PowerZamAI. He has advised 37 of 50 companies, including Coca-Cola, Raytheon, and The Family Café. His business has grown by 40% in six months thanks to AI.

articles.title: Anthropic To Open India Office As Claude Usage Surges
articles.author: Moz Farooque ACCA
articles.summary: Anthropic, the AI startup backed by Google and Amazon, is making a big move into India. The company plans to open its first Indian office in Bengaluru in early 2026. India is one of Anthropic's fastest-growing markets and now ranks as the second-largest user base for its Claude chatbot. Anthropic is valued at $183 billion after a $13 billion Series F round in September.

articles.title: How to spot AI-generated content: 4 ways to sharpen your digital awareness
articles.author: Lauren Tippetts
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence becomes more sophisticated, distinguishing real content from AI-generated content is getting more difficult. Sarah Kimmel, from Family Tech Zone, shares her tips on how to identify fake AI content.    She recommends paying attention to your emotions and looking for visual inconsistencies.

articles.title: Report: Acrisure to fire nearly 400 in move to AI
articles.author: Katherine Wilkison
articles.summary: Acrisure will cut about 400 jobs next year, including nearly 200 in Grand Rapids. The company bought Tulco's artificial intelligence insurance business in 2020 for $400 million. Acrisure notified workers of the upcoming layoffs via a memo sent Wednesday. The permanent layoffs will be in 2026.

articles.title: Apache Gold Casino & Resort Completes Upgrade to QCI's Latest Release, AGI56
articles.summary: Apache Gold Casino & Resort has completed its upgrade to AGI56, QCI's most advanced enterprise platform release to date. QCI is a global leader in AI-driven analytics and operational intelligence for casinos and resorts. The QCI AGI Platform manages more than $42 billion in annual gross gaming revenue.

articles.title: all the apps already available and to come
articles.summary: ChatGPT just got a huge upgrade with integration with Spotify, Canva, Figma, Zillow, Expedia, and Booking.com. The company has announced a robust roadmap of additional integrations coming in the next few months. It's about solidifying the conversational interface as the future of computing.

articles.title: This Listing for a Rental House Is Mangled With AI So Badly That You'll Cackle Out Loud
articles.author: Victor Tangermann
articles.summary: In the age of generative AI, it's hard to distinguish between reality and a fiction dreamed up by an AI. Zillow listing for a single-family rental home in Detroit, Michigan shows the two-story building in a far-too-flattering light. Artist DeAnn Wiley pointed out that the reality is completely different.

articles.title: Major Grand Rapids company laying off 400 people due to AI, 200 in West Michigan
articles.author: Brian Mcvicar
articles.summary: The company Acrisure plans to cut 400 accounting positions in the first quarter of 2026. Half of the positions will be based in West Michigan, the rest across the company's global footprint. CEO Greg Williams calls the decision 'painful' but necessary as the company continues its technology transformation that began with a $400 million AI acquisition in 2020.

articles.title: Major Grand Rapids company laying off 400 people due to AI, 200 in West Michigan
articles.author: Michigan Live
articles.summary: The company's CEO called the decision "painful" but necessary as the firm continues its technology transformation that began with a $400 million AI acquisition in 2020. The company will make a decision on the AI acquisition later this year or in 2019, depending on the company's progress.

articles.title: OpenAI's Nick Turley on transforming ChatGPT into an operating system
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Nick Turley is the head of ChatGPT. He wants to turn it into an operating system full of third-party apps. OpenAI is also working on a browser and a family of hardware devices. The launch of apps aligns with OpenAI's desire to turn ChatG PTP into an e-commerce destination.

articles.title: Humanoid robot ‘superworker' unveiled to offer dexterous industrial assistance
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: Ati Motors, an Indian company in AI and autonomous robotics has announced the launch of its latest robotic system, the Sherpa Mecha humanoid. Sherpa is the world's first humanoid-inspired robot designed for practical manufacturing applications. It aims to replicate human appearance and motion.

articles.title: AI Might Be Able To Predict Your Risk Of Alzheimer's Just By Listening To How You Talk
articles.author: Michael Levanduski
articles.summary: The study took recorded and transcribed audio recordings from 166 people with MCI and fed it into the AI to train the system. The AI had an accuracy rate of 78.5%, which is very impressive. The recordings were collected from people who were 63-97 years old. The team fed in speech samples from patients recorded in the past.

articles.title: 1Password says it can fix login security for AI browser agents
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: 1Password's browser extension fills in your passwords automatically when you browse the web. New Secure Agentic Autofill feature allows AI bots browsing the web on your behalf to do the same. It's available starting today in early access via Browserbase, which builds a browser and tools specifically for AI agents.

articles.title: Robin Williams' daughter Zelda to fans: Stop sending me AI videos of my dad
articles.author: Boston Herald
articles.summary: Zelda wants fans to stop sending her AI-generated videos of her late father, Robin Williams, to express her disapproval of the tributes to him on Instagram. Zelda is the only daughter of the late comedian Robin Williams and is upset with the AI tributes.

articles.title: Report finds only 9% of firms have full data access for AI use
articles.author: IT Brief Australia
articles.summary: Only 9% of firms report full access to their data for AI use, despite 86% being data driven. Cloudera's survey of 1,574 IT leaders worldwide found this out from their survey of data-driven IT leaders.

articles.title: The Original AI: Newspapers run on accurate information
articles.author: KEN PAULSON Guest Columnist
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is going to transform everything we watch, hear and read. Asking and AI search engine a question about an obscure fact can yield quick and surprisingly detailed responses. When it comes to transforming TV show casts into babies, AI is world-class.

articles.title: As SoundHound Announces New Apivia Deal, Should You Buy, Sell, or Hold SOUN Stock?
articles.author: Wajeeh Khan
articles.summary: SoundHound AI (SOUN) announced an artificial intelligence (AI) deal with Apivia Courtage, a subsidiary of Paris-headquartered AEMA Group. SoundHound stock is up nearly 170% versus its year-to-date low in April. The company's revenue more than tripled on a year-over-year basis to $42.7 million in its fiscal Q2. Wall Street firms have a consensus 'Moderate Buy' rating on SOUN shares.

articles.title: AI Deals Are Starting to Get Weird: Why Some Analysts Are Worried (And Others, Not So Much)
articles.author: Noah Weidner
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence holds the promise of revolutionizing industry, curing diseases, and solving humanity's biggest problems. Tech companies are spending billions to scale up their data centers and position for the coming revolution.      Â   .  .

articles.title: Kevin Frazier: Why academic debates about AI mislead lawmakers — and the public
articles.author: Kevin Frazier The Fulcrum
articles.summary: Lawmakers and academics are arguing about the future of artificial intelligence (AI) in the media and in the political arena. They focus on speculative hypotheticals rather than on the real issues that affect people's lives, such as job displacement, worker retraining, and community instability. Legislators should focus on use cases, industries, contexts, and contexts.

articles.title: AI deepfakes drive global surge in online child abuse, experts warn
articles.author: Blitz
articles.summary: The rise of artificial intelligence has brought many opportunities to the world, but it has also unleashed a darker side that experts now describe as one of the most serious threats of the time.    "This is not just an emerging threat – it's a crisis that's already here"

articles.title: How Influencer Storefronts Impact Marketing
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Forbes CMO newsletter includes the following topics: Calculating the value of marketing, Meta to use AI data for targeted ads, Nike takes flight in Philly, Hollywood hates AI actors and Nike goes to New York.    forbes.com/cmo.

articles.title: Can AI Learn And Evolve Like A Brain? Pathway's Bold Research Thinks So
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Pathway claims to have uncovered the mathematical blueprint of intelligence and built an AI named Baby Dragon Hatchling (BDH) that evolves like the human brain. It is named after a mythical dragon that lives in space and time and can perceive and act on its environment.

articles.title: Four Challenges In Gaming And Learning Innovation With AI
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: There are many challenges that business leaders have to deal with when developing ground-breaking AI applications. The quality bar for AI development is higher than before, and it's harder to support and maintain a project that may have been started very easily. Users tend to be fickle and demanding over the long-term. There are no-code building, features and on-boarding, which is common in gamified and learning apps.

articles.title: Billionaire PC tycoon Michael Dell is riding the AI gold rush—and he says the party's far from over even if eventually ‘there'll be too many' data centers
articles.author: Marco Quiroz-Gutierrez
articles.summary: Michael Dell revolutionized the personal computer industry with Dell Technologies in the late '90s and is now the 10th richest person in the world. Dell Technologies' stock has skyrocketed 32% in the past year thanks to the increasing importance of the infrastructure services it provides to customers like OpenAI. The company's server-networking business grew 58% last year and Dell predicts its annual revenue growth will exceed expectations at 7% to 9%.

articles.title: Man Embraces AI at Work, Gets Rewarded by Boss Replacing Him With It
articles.author: Frank Landymore
articles.summary: Kevin Cantera quit his job because his boss wanted to use AI for his work. He was a researcher and historian at the edutech company for 17 years. He got replaced by a large language model, along with a couple dozen of his coworkers, despite his boss' assurances that he wouldn't be replaced with AI.

articles.title: National View: Don't oppose data centers; they'll keep the US safe
articles.summary: There is a new kind of NIMBYism: those opposing the construction of data centers in their communities. Data centers are large warehouse-like facilities filled with computer servers. Tech companies require increasing amounts of this equipment to store data and provide commercial services. Everything from accessing information online to seeing medical specialists, shopping, and education will be affected by AI. There is a modern version of the Cold War arms race between the U.S. and China to dominate this transformative technology. President Donald Trump recently announced his 'Winning the AI Race: America's AI Action Plan'

articles.title: DeSantis wants AI regulation; insurance lobby says Florida has it under control
articles.author: Livia Caputo
articles.summary: Gov. Ron DeSantis has hinted at legislation addressing the rapid growth of artificial intelligence. Insurance lobbyists argued before a Florida House panel Tuesday that state law already regulates AI in the insurance sphere. The lobbyists insisted that generative AI is helping to process claims and detect fraud and is designed to help — not replace — the workforce.

articles.title: University Wrongly Accuses Students of Using Artificial Intelligence to Cheat
articles.author: ABC Australia
articles.summary: An Australian university has accused thousands of its students of cheating with artificial intelligence. Many of them haven't done anything wrong, according to the university's own investigation. The problem is that many of them have done nothing wrong at all, as the university points out.

articles.title: AMD Hits All-Time High After Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Calls Offering 10% Stake To OpenAI ‘Clever'
articles.author: Stocktwits Inc
articles.summary: AMD stock reached a record high of $230.36 on Wednesday. The chip maker had inked a major infrastructure agreement with OpenAI and granted the ChatGPT maker a warrant for up to 160 million shares of its common stock on Tuesday. NVIDIA Corp. CEO Jensen Huang called the move 'unique and surprising' because of AMD's enthusiasm for its upcoming product.

articles.title: 3 Ways Managers Can Use AI To Help Frontline Worker Burnout
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI can both help and hurt worker burnout. It's critical that managers take a proactive approach in deploying AI with their teams to prevent it from being misused and to prevent burnout in the workplace.       .   for more information, go to: http://www.justgiving.com/how-to-use-ai-for-workplace-health-care-benefits-and-management/

articles.title: The Hidden Crisis Of AI Leadership
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Tech CEOs are drowning in AI tools. The secret to winning is to stop trying to master everything and start orchestrating smarter, says Jeff Bezos, CEO of Amazon. He believes that AI is the key to winning in the tech industry.    .

articles.title: Humanoid robot 'superworker' offers dexterous industrial assistance
articles.author: Kaif Shaikh
articles.summary: Sherpa Mecha is an industrial robot designed for practical, industrial purposes. It has high-performance actuators, precision gripping, and 3D navigation. It operates on wheels rather than legs, allowing it to move faster and more safely across industrial environments. The robot's modular AI and actuation systems are products of collaboration between Ati Motors and several research institutions, academic partners and industrial clients.

articles.title: As they labor to fight off the slop bots, Wikipedia maintain...
articles.author: Jason Kottke
articles.summary: Wikipedia maintains a list of signs that the text written by AI was written by slop bots. The list is descriptive, not prescriptive, and consists of observations, not rules. It is intended to be useful for the AI developers.   - Wikipedia.

articles.title: Florida lawmakers: It's time to consider regulations on AI to protect students
articles.summary: 100,000 students in Miami-Dade County Public Schools are using Google's Gemini chatbot in the classroom to grade essays and bring their lesson plans to life. The University of Florida has created the Florida K-12 AI Education Task Force, and they've developed AI guidelines for schools.

articles.title: Why higher ed's AI rush could put corporate interests over public service and independence
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence technology has begun to transform higher education. It is raising a new question: What is the future of higher education?    i.e. what is the role of artificial intelligence in higher education and how will it be used? i.a.

articles.title: Here's what Jony Ive and Sam Altman revealed about their secretive AI hardware project at OpenAI's Dev Day
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Jony Ive are working together on AI-powered devices. Altman bought Ive's hardware startup Io for $6.5 billion in May. Ive designed the iPhone. ChatGPT was the launch of his post-Apple design collective, LoveFrom.

articles.title: Samsung AI researcher's new, open reasoning model TRM outperforms models 10,000X larger — on specific problems
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Alexia Jolicoeur-Martineau, Senior AI Researcher at Samsung's Advanced Institute of Technology (SAIT) in Montreal, Canada, has introduced the Tiny Recursion Model (TRM) - a neural network so small it contains just 7 million parameters. It competes with or surpasses cutting-edge language models 10,000 times larger in terms of their parameter count. The code is available now on Github under an enterprise-friendly, commercially viable MIT License.

articles.title: Sam Altman says that intellectual property is a lot trickier for video: 'The video feels much more real and lifelike'
articles.author: Business Insider
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says intellectual property rights holders view AI video differently. Altman has already announced changes to OpenAI's Sora app that will give more power to IP rights holders.       .   in the video feels much more real and lifelike.

articles.title: CoreWeave stock rallies as it introduces new AI tools for developers
articles.author: Jordan Novet
articles.summary: CoreWeave shares rose as much as 8% Wednesday as the artificial intelligence cloud provider announced new tools to help programmers develop AI agents. The launch comes five months after CoreWeave paid $1 billion to acquire Weights and Biases, a startup targeting developers with software for training and evaluating AI models.

articles.title: Review: Beeple, McBride make mayhem with AI at weekend shows
articles.author: Maura Hogan
articles.summary: Danny McBride and Beeple collaborated on "Synthetic Theatre" in Charleston. It's a theatrical exploration of the potential and the limits of AI. The overarching question is whether AI can enhance or supplant human-powered artistic performance. The thrust of the art to be created was often crowd-sourced from the audience.

articles.title: Relace raises $23M in funding led by Andreessen Horowitz to build tools for AI coding agents
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: Relace has raised $23 million in Series A funding from Andreessen Horowitz, Matrix Partners and Y Combinator. The company was founded by Preston Zhou and Eitan Borgnia a few months ago. It aims to build a development toolkit for AI agents.

articles.title: Can AI Learn And Evolve Like A Brain? Pathway's Bold Research Thinks So
articles.author: Victor Dey
articles.summary: Pathway claims its new AI architecture, Baby Dragon Hatchling (BDH), represents a breakthrough in adaptive reasoning. It mathematically maps how neurons interact to form and refine understanding over time. It simulates how reasoning develops, showing neurons interacting to find the next relevant idea, much like how the brain directs focus across its networks.

articles.title: OpenAI study reveals 44 jobs most at risk of being replaced by AI
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: OpenAI has published a paper on the 44 jobs most likely to be taken over by artificial intelligence. AI performed as well as or better than humans in about 48% of tests. Professions that were hit hard include counter and retail clerks, sales managers and shipping clerks, who were outperformed in 80% of the time. Editors, software developers, and private investigators were also badly hit. Even roles that rely on human interaction, like social workers, were not immune to AI.

articles.title: "Terrible idea": Critics say the new "Tinder for Jobs" app proves everything wrong with modern hiring
articles.author: Anna Good
articles.summary: Sorce is a job-hunting app created by college students. It claims its AI will fill out forms, write cover letters, and manage multiple application portals. Since its inception in August 2024, it has facilitated over 7.5 million swipes, helping candidates secure hundreds of interviews daily. The team claims its app hosts 1.6 million jobs.

articles.title: Study: AI use alarming students, teachers, parents
articles.author: Troy Wolverton
articles.summary: According to a new study, high school students are concerned about how artificial intelligence is being used in and affecting education and they have a good reason to be.       .   in light of the study, they are worried about the future of education.

articles.title: Women Unaware of Mammogram Advances
articles.author: David M. Higgins II
articles.summary: MedStar Health released a national survey on women's knowledge of advanced mammography technologies. Nearly half of eligible U.S. women over 40 do not get regular mammograms and more than one in 10 have never had one. In Maryland, breast cancer incidence stands at 135.5 new cases per 100,000 women annually.

articles.title: Gregory FCA Launches AI Search Optimization Platform for Financial Firms
articles.author: Timothy Alexander
articles.summary: Gregory FCA has introduced the Gregory Influence Engine, an artificial intelligence-driven platform to help financial services companies improve visibility and citations in AI search results. The company cites key industry metrics driving the shift: 60% of U.S. adults now use AI to find information, organic traffic in finance is down 7.4% year over year. AI referrals to the top 1,000 websites have surged 357% over the past year.

articles.title: Attentive® Introduces Smarter, Simpler Features for Brands to Engage Customers
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Attentive has announced a new portfolio of solutions that cut through complexity and empower marketers to create authentic, profitable customer connections at scale. It's the AI marketing platform for 1:1 personalization redefining how brands and people connect.   Â

articles.title: Suki Announces AI-Driven Nursing Consortium to Address Global Nursing Shortages
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Suki has announced the formation of a consortium focused on leveraging artificial intelligence to alleviate the global nursing shortage. The consortium brings together prominent healthcare systems, nursing schools, and technology partners. The core aim is to develop and deploy AI tools that streamline nursing workflows and reduce administrative burdens.

articles.title: The Army's New Intel Playbook: How AI and Data Are Rewriting the Battlefield
articles.summary: The U.S. Army is heavily utilizing artificial intelligence tools to enhance decision-making, automate back-office functions and develop new capabilities for battlefield awareness and autonomous systems. Department of Defense has awarded contracts to major AI firms like Anthropic, Google, OpenAI, and x…

articles.title: People-pleasing chatbots may boost your ego, but they can weaken your judgment
articles.author: Paul Arnold
articles.summary: Stanford University and Carnegie Mellon University researchers found that people-pleasing chatbots can have a detrimental impact on our judgment and behavior. They found that sycophantic AI models affirmed a user's actions 50% more often than people would in similar situations. People trusted AI more when it agreed with them when it was flattering.

articles.title: Will A.I. Trap You in the 'Permanent Underclass'?
articles.author: New Yorker
articles.summary: An online joke reflects a sincere fear about how A.I. automation will upend the labor market and create a new norm of inequality, as the joke points out.    i.e. it will create an inequality between rich and poor as a result of automation.

articles.title: IREN Ltd. (IREN) Hits Fresh Record High Anew on Supply Deals; to Raise Potential $1 Billion in Fresh Funds
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: IREN Ltd. (NASDAQ:IREN) is one of the best performers on Tuesday. The company has successfully deployed 11,000 Nvidia Blackwell GPUs to its existing AI partners. articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is increasingly being used by Swiss small-and-medium enterprises (SMEs) according to a survey by research institute Sotomo. This is especially the case for SMEs in the small and medium sized business.

articles.title: Lessons From 10 AI Strategies That Failed To Deliver Business Value
articles.author: Nav Thethi
articles.summary: Nav Thethi has helped business leaders across industries navigate digital optimization to rise on the digital maturity scale and the challenges of AI integration. articles.title: The API-First Sales Advantage: Lessons From Building An Email Platform

articles.summary: Alexey Kachalov is the co-founder and CTO of UniOne, an API-first email delivery platform serving 2,000+ users across 30+ countries. He explains the benefits of using an API first approach to grow a company's business.

articles.title: The Case For AI-Empowered Entry-Level Talent
articles.author: Tan Moorthy
articles.summary: Tan Moorthy is the CEO of Revature, a technology talent as a service provider. He believes that AI can be a powerful tool for early-career employees. articles.title: EDITORIAL: Zoom in on Colorado's criminal element
articles.author: The Gazette Editorial Board
articles.summary: Aurora's City Council tentatively OK'd facial recognition for use by the city's police. It's the largest law enforcement agency in the state to do so so far. Denver and Colorado Springs police departments and the El Paso County Sheriff's Office haven't implemented it yet.

articles.title: EU Rolls Out 1-Billion-Euro Plan to Ramp up AI in Key Industries Amid Sovereignty Drive
articles.author: Business Times
articles.summary: The European Commission announced a one-billion-euro (S$1.5 billion) plan to ramp up the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in key industries. There is a push to cut the European Union's budget deficit by cutting subsidies for industries that rely on AI.

articles.title: EU wants key sectors to use made-in-Europe AI
articles.author: AFP AFP
articles.summary: The EU told European businesses in critical sectors to ramp up their uptake of artificial intelligence and pushed for the bloc to cut its dependence on foreign AI providers. The EU wants European businesses to cut their dependence onforeign AI providers and to focus on their own AI technology.

articles.title: Beyond Agile: The Rise Of AI SDLC
articles.author: Mike Hyzy
articles.summary: Mike Hyzy is Vice President of Strategy and Innovation at CGI. He believes that traditional software development life cycle (SDLC) is under strain due to the use of AI. AI can be used to improve the quality of software development and improve the efficiency of the overall process.

articles.title: AI isn't smart enough to destroy us
articles.author: Eric Oliver
articles.summary: Eric Oliver is a professor of political science at the University of Chicago. He is the author of the book 'How to Know Your Self: The Art and Science of Discovering Who You Really Are.' He believes that artificial intelligence will destroy humanity itself.

articles.title: Reducing Risk: Microsegmentation Means Faster Incident Response, Lower Insurance Premiums for Organizations
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: New report shows organizations that implement microsegmentation reduce ransomware containment times and improve cyber insurance terms. Half of non-adopters plan to implement within two years, while more than two-thirds of current adopters expect to increase their investment. The report also shows that organizations increasingly associate segmentation maturity with lower insurance premiums and faster claims processing.

articles.title: Reducing Risk: Microsegmentation Means Faster Incident Response, Lower Insurance Premiums for Organizations
articles.author: Akamai Technologies
articles.summary: Akamai Technologies has released a new report on microsegmentation. The report surveyed 1,200 security and technology leaders worldwide. It found that it reduces ransomware containment time and improves cyber insurance position. Half of non-adopters plan to implement within two years, and two-thirds of current adopters expect to increase their investment.

articles.title: AI is supposed to kill jobs. Instead, AI companies are hiring in droves, fueling a resurgence of Silicon Valley offices.
articles.summary: Some AI executives have been predicting big job losses due to the technology, but many AI companies are hiring huge numbers of human employees. That's driving an unlikely resurgence in Silicon Valley's office market. Since 2020, there have been 5.2 million square feet of office lease transactions by AI and AI-infrastructure companies in the Silicon Valley.

articles.title: Trump's quest to cure cancer with AI is powered by energy that can cause it
articles.author: Ariel Wittenberg
articles.summary: Trump signed an executive order last week to bolster the use of artificial intelligence in finding cancer cures for kids. EPA has targeted 12 rules that reduce cancer-causing chemicals like benzene, heavy metals and soot from being released into the nation's air and water. EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin wrote last week that 'through strategic deregulation' his agency 'is helping ensure that America doesn't just participate in the AI revolution — we lead it.'

articles.title: OpenAI launches apps inside of ChatGPT

articles.title: Alibaba's Qwen Technology Lead Sets Up In-House Robot AI Team

articles.title: The Future of Intelligence Is Open
articles.author: Greg Levesque
articles.summary: The world is at an inflection point for intelligence and national security. The explosion of openly available data and artificial intelligence (AI) capable of processing it at scale is redefining it. The game has changed beneath our feet. We are in the middle of renewed great-power rivalry. AI, quantum computing, and synthetic biology will shape the geopolitical order of the next century.

articles.title: AMD's Landmark Deal with OpenAI Marks a New Phase in the AI Chip Race

OpenAI CEO Sam Altman noted that the AMD deal will help his startup build enough AI infrastructure to meet its needs.

articles.title: People are using ChatGPT as a lawyer in court. Some are winning.
articles.summary: Some AI-drafted court documents are often littered with inaccuracies and faulty reasoning. Chatbots are trained on vast datasets to predict the most likely response to a query but sometimes encounter gaps in their knowledge.

It also creates serious economic challenges for innovators working in a borderless digital economy. Some have suggested pausing new state laws until Congress acts.
